title: Theatre veteran Andrew Lloyd Webber uses new technology to promote his Broadway musical
text:
Theatre veteran Andrew Lloyd Webber uses new technology to promote his Broadway musical 11:00am EDT - 01:08 
Andrew Lloyd Webber offers a glimpse of his latest musical, a stage adaptation of hit 2003 film comedy ''School of Rock'' with 360 degree video. Holly Rubenstein reports.   
Theatre legend Andrew Lloyd Webber is returning to Broadway with his new musical, "School of Rock". Previewing next month, it's a stage adaptation of Jack Black's hit comedy film about Dewey Finn, a wannabe rockstar substitute teacher who forms a band with his young pupils. SOUNDBITE Composer, Andrew Lloyd Webber saying (English): "It kind of takes me back to the time when I was able to write with children and work with children. It was just - to me, it was a bit of fresh air really." Lloyd Webber's offering a glimpse of the production with an immersive 360 degree music video. Viewers can scroll around the class room on their phone or tablet while listening to a song from the score. SOUNDBITE Composer, Andrew Lloyd Webber saying (English): "It's happening all around you, all in one go. It's all in one take, you can't edit it because everybody is always in a different position. So it was a great experiment, we had a very good, fun day filming it." Featuring songs from the film, new music from Lloyd Webber, and a book by Downton Abbey-creator Julian Fellowes, "School of Rock" previews at the Winter Garden Theatre from November 9.  //reut.rs/1Ms9yZP
